Class ApplicationRepository

java.lang.Object
database.ApplicationRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudRepository<InternshipApplication, String>, Student.AppReadPort
public class ApplicationRepository extends Object implements CrudRepository<InternshipApplication, String>, Student.AppReadPort
In-memory repository for managing InternshipApplication entities.

This repository provides CRUD operations for internship applications while also implementing Student.AppReadPort to support domain-level validation queries required by student business rules, such as counting active applications and checking for confirmed placements.

The repository maintains applications in insertion order for predictable iteration and supports CSV-based persistence for data storage and retrieval.

    • existsByStudentAndInternship

      public boolean existsByStudentAndInternship(String studentId, String internshipId)
      Checks if a duplicate application exists for the same student and internship.

      This method prevents students from applying multiple times to the same internship.

      Parameters:
      studentId - the student's ID
      internshipId - the internship's ID
      Returns:
      true if a duplicate application exists, false otherwise

    • countActiveByStudent

      public long countActiveByStudent(String studentId)
      Counts active applications for a student.

      Active applications are defined as those with status PENDING or SUCCESSFUL but not yet accepted by the student.

      Parameters:
      studentId - the student's ID
      Returns:
      the count of active applications

    • countAcceptedForInternship

      public long countAcceptedForInternship(String internshipId)
      Counts accepted applications for an internship.

      This can be used to cross-check if an internship has reached its capacity.

      Parameters:
      internshipId - the internship's ID
      Returns:
      the count of accepted applications

      public void deleteByStudent(String studentId)

      Useful for cleanup when a student account is deleted.

      Parameters:
      studentId - the student's ID

    • hasConfirmedPlacement

      public boolean hasConfirmedPlacement(String studentId)
      Checks if a student has a confirmed placement.

      A confirmed placement is defined as a SUCCESSFUL application that has been accepted by the student.

      Specified by:
      hasConfirmedPlacement in interface Student.AppReadPort
      Parameters:
      studentId - the student's ID
      Returns:
      true if the student has a confirmed placement, false otherwise

    • saveToCsv

      public void saveToCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Saves all applications to a CSV file.

      The CSV format includes the following columns:

      • ApplicationID
      • AppliedOn
      • StudentID
      • InternshipID
      • Status
      • StudentAccepted

      Parent directories are created automatically if they don't exist.

      Parameters:
      path - the output CSV file path
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      SecurityException - if file access is denied

    • loadFromCsv

      public void loadFromCsv(String path, StudentRepository students, InternshipRepository internships) throws IOException
      Loads applications from a CSV file and attaches resolved student and internship references.

      This method attempts to resolve student and internship references using the provided repositories. Applications that cannot be resolved (missing student or internship) are skipped and diagnostic information is printed to help identify resolution issues.

      The CSV file should have a header row with case-insensitive column names that can include:

      • ApplicationID, ID
      • AppliedOn, Applied, Date
      • StudentID, Student, SID
      • InternshipID, Internship, IID
      • Status
      • StudentAccepted, Accepted
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the CSV file
      students - the student repository for resolving student references
      internships - the internship repository for resolving internship references
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      SecurityException - if file access is denied
